title: How nice are hostels of Amity University, Noida? - Quora

response.answer_text: They are the worst kind of hostels anyone can ever see that too with price too high for hostel and that too excluding mess charges. The only advantage is that being in amity you probably reach in class on time. Otherwise every thing is worst in hostel no differentiation in UG and PG students and also the environment of hostel is such that you can never study with concentration as there are so many students here (around 500 in one hostel) and that to they are doing all sorta of things in hostel and starts shouting suddenly in night time and that too whole night, from how many student you will ask to shut up but they will keep doing the same, no ambiance to study dull lights, no privacy. The rooms are basicaly designed with no particular form and shape and also not designed for 3 students in single room but they will put three students in one room.They will not give any added advantage to UG students that they are doing higher studies so they should be given more preferance and should not be disturbed, also most the time the request for changing the room is not permitted so if you are stuck with disturbing room mate you are stuck for whole year almost this is confirmed. The hostel feels like jail you are not allowed to go any where after 9PM not allowed even to roam in campus and also from one hostel to another you are not allowed to go even in day time, the water for bathing purpose is also not good and everytime there is some or other construction or repair work going on in hostel believe me this is very disturbing if are get disturbed easily hostel is not you place, so if you are looking for quite environment believe me never come in hostel, you have to sign attendance register daily at night even if you are present in hostel and you want to sleep so that you can study later when less noisy environment is there, they will put the register around 8PM at night on the ground floor table then you sign and sometime when you dont go in class in class they will ask why you are not going to class, even if you have that day off they will try to disturb you any way they like and also finds new ways to do so, just for showing that we care for you which they definetly not, and one you paid the fees for hostel you are trapped in their for one year and you cannot leave the hostel after 3 month of joining and they will deduct 6 month of hostel charge for that. Everywhere you have to go with id card and punch it which most of the time dont work but its just a showoff. Believe me taking hostel is work decision i took in Amity, also the amount which you pay them is way above what they should give you so please dont opt for hostel at least i can say that and also ask senior which you may know and ask 100 times and be sure before you come to amity and ask about the placements also.

Choosing where to study, and to which university you should go, is one of the most important decisions you will make.Honestly I don’t have idea about hostel life of Amity University.I have studied in Lovely Professional University. Hostel Life……Wow! Excited! I have lived in hostel and I hope this will help you get a clear picture of the kind of life a hosteller leads at the Lovely Professional University.I feel like I’m fully eligible to answer this question. The major concern of the parents is the security and safety of their children and LPU is well known for its security. Turnstiles gates are there at the entry of hostels so that no other person should enter the hostel. Since LPU has this very BIG Campus So, the girls hostels are at the beginning of the Campus and ends in between the Campus and from there starts the Boys Hostel and ends at the end of the Campus and So, you will get a choice to choose your hostel near to your block. When I first entered LPU I was feeling fascinated by looking at the infrastructure of the Campus and on the other hand I was also feeling very nervous about my life at Campus Hostel but trust me I shouldn’t have been because I had an awesome Hostel Life, Made so many friends, created so many memories, learned from many experiences, etc. To some people a hostel may sound like restriction but to me it never was, I always had my own enough space.I have lived in a Flat outside Campus and inside Campus hostel too. If I had to rate between the both , The Hostel life was much much better. All facilitates are provided at the Campus Hostel and you’ll have the complete choice to choose the accommodation that suits you and your budget. I can tell you everything is available inside campus so you don’t need to worry about anything. Uni mall is present in LPU which consists of everything whether it is clothing,cosmetics,grocery,accessories,electronics etc. Tuck shops are present within hostels from there also you can buy things of your choice like mattress, blankets etc. Canteens and food stalls are also present with all kinds of food like south indian, north indian, chinese food etc.Zero Ragging/ Zero Discrimination : Nobody is ragged at LPU, This word actually doesn’t exists here. There is a complete secularism in the LPU hostel life as you will find seniors and juniors treated similarly at the Campus and even at the Hostel. So, there is no division among the students as per their academic year like other campus hostel’s. Students from the various ends of the country/ neighboring countries come and join LPU and lives in the same Hostel without any discrimination.Food/ Mess : Honestly I won’t lie about the mess at campus, because I myself took food for the first 6 months at the hostel mess until I explored other good places but there are so many people who actually like mess. If you’r one of them very good and if not then fab you’r in my gang so, you don’t have to worry at all for the food at LPU because there are like 358+ shops inside the campus providing all varieties of food from continental to south Indian and that too at very mediocre rates. Some days if you don’t feel like going out you can even order at Dominoes, go to CCD, Mall, etc Food is not at all a problem at LPU.Outdoor Games/ Indoor Games/Gym : There are so many places at Campus for out door games and as well as indoor games. Some are campus properties and some are vendor properties (game parlors) where you’ll have to pay to play. Everything is fun wherever you fit in yourself.No outsiders are allowed in the university without a gate pass. Meaning even if parents of students come for visit, they have the access to university through gate pass only.Any publicly offensive acts are clearly not allowed in the university and strict actions are taken against such act.Other than this if any girl faces any issues regarding anything that she faces, she can file a complain of the RMS, against that particular issues or person, strict actions are taken immediately by the authorities. Other than this, in case of emotional breakdowns, there are happiness cells available in the university where anyone can go and discuss their problemsPersonal Experience: Getting bored is not an option at LPU because you’ll be busy with your classes for more than half of the day and other time with habits and passion if you’r a passion follower and If not you’ll become one before you leave LPU. Here you’ll find many like that! After getting free from all this then you’ll barely have sometime with your hostel mates or roommates but still they will always remain an integral part of your life. I have learnt a lot during my days, you’ll too but never let it ruin your true self. There will be times when situation will demand a change, go with your own decision(right or wrong) and never ever listen to the crowd because they’ll always try to make you part of them which you aren’t born to be! Thanks!Cheers to your New Life!

In June 2015 a young guy was very excited as he was about to start his college life and for the first time in his life he was about to leave his home and was suppose to go to Noida for further studies. He took admission in Amity and opted for hostel.He was given a bunk bed room which typically means that there were two bunk beds and four people inside a tiny little room.  The picture of bunk bed might look good but the reality is not. All this was fine he thought that no problem of bunk bed I will still spend my time with my friends and will go out and explore places but then suddenly a thunder striked him and he got to know that he was not allowed to leave the campus premises from Monday to Friday and he was like  Again he thought that no problem….I would go out on weekends and would enjoy and once again Amity was like  You will have to get a day pass from your warden which would be valid till 6 PM and if you are late then you will have to face the consequences and for leaving the hostel on night you will have to get night pass which will be issued after your parents message your warden and your warden verifies the message and then he would issue it…the problem is not about getting the hostel pass the problem is struggle that we have to do to get the pass it will be issued only in the morning so if by chance you slept till 11 AM on a so called pleasant weekend keep sleeping bro no chance of you getting out. Hostel gates were closed at 9 PM and after that you are stuck in your room until sun rises again. A few months passed and I was like  Everyday was important for me and all I wanted was freedom somehow a year passed and I immediately got a flat in Noida with some of my friends and I lived happily ever after and yes the story is about me. PS:Do not consider hostel life to be as bad as described in this answer I have had many memorable memories in hostel too but I thought that freedom was the most necessary thing for me.

Hostels at Amity Noida are the worstttt!! I stayed in the hostel for 1 hr after which i applied for the withdrawal of money they're not worth the fees moreover ac will only work from 6pm to 6am even on the off days i chose ac hostel so as to acquire the best of the facilities bt this is the condition of the hostel m very much disappointed rooms are very small its very suffocating without ac there…moreover the faculties they are worst of a kind!! I've had a very bad experience in the amity hostel(ac) idk about non ac ….pg accommodation are the besttt now I'm living in pg nearby it where the rooms are very spacy , ac can be switched off and on by our wish, 4 times meals is provided(unlike amity hostel where food is not included), laundary service, free wifi, moreover they also have pick up and drop facility for free nd they charge around half the fees of ac hostels at Amity…i would personally suggest you to live in pg rather than in the amity hostel….(consider this and thank me later)

The hostel facilities at Amity are nice but due to increasing number of students with each passing year the campus hostel is not able to cope up with the space requirements of students. For those coming to study at Amity University Noida I would recommend choosing Placio for staying which provides them professionally managed student housing facilities on co-living basis. Comfort to luxury options are available for both male and female students, separately. The compounds are guarded by security personnel 24/7. Placio also provided 24/7 SOS helpline to help student residents in case of emergencies - personal or medical. At Placio verified properties students get services like housekeeping, maintenance, buffet and lot more. There are no unnecessary curfew hours so that students can enjoy safe and independent life. Placio also provides things like pick-up and drop facility to Amity University, student cards, customer support, parking areas, gaming areas,etc. A completely unparalleled student co-living experience in Noida.

Amity University is located in Sector 125 Noida. There are two types of hostels AC and Non AC. It depends on you now which hostel ypu choose. AC hostels have single occupied rooms and a common room for 4 such rooms. Whereas Non AC are double or triple sharing. But if you are too lucky enough, you can be alloted a single room in Non AC too. They are good. Atleast better than hostels of many other private universities but yes rooms are a bit less spacy but that is okay if you are alloted single room. There are cafeterias in campus which will offer you variety of food. If you take my suggestion, spend your 1st and 2nd year in Amity hostels and then you can move out to flats. That will be best. Also keep your attendance and CGPA good. Else you may have the chance of losing hostels in the next sessions. Amity is too serious about attendance. Also, the in timings of the hostel is 10pm.

I study in Amity university, but I don't live in the hostel,  but many of friends do.  There are a lot of restrictions there. 1. You can't bring  your Day-Scholar friends ( who don't live in hostel) to your room.  2. You can't go outside the Amity campus without any permission from the teacher their.  Except on Saturday and Sunday  3. You have to be their in your room before 9 pm. (the time might have changed,  and is different for boys and girls),  and if you won't be there,  you will be penalized.  4. If you are non vegetarian,  you cant eat food.  5. You will see,  your friends going in and out of college every time,  but you can't be able to go,  because you are hostlier.  (But you can always pay the guard 10-50 Rs.)  Seriously,  they can leave you,  for 10 Rs.  The only positive thing Is that....  You are safe there.

I was a Day scholar at Amity University, Noida but am familiar with the hostels, as many of my friends used to stay there. Hostels are of 2 types- AC and Non AC. The AC hostels resemble a quality hotel and the Non AC ones are good and decent, with less amenties. Single room and double rooms are available. There is no mess facility as such like in other colleges. You can buy food at its price from the canteen in the Hostel Block (H-Block) or from other restaurants like Dominos , Subway, Wall Street, Bikano, Amul, Popcorns and More etc. In a nutshell, hostels are good. As a first year student, you should definitely consider the hostel if you live far away as timing of classes is from 9–5. As you get accustomed to college life, you can move to a Paying Guest Accommodation, though, I still recommend Hostel considering safety and convenience to attend classes on the go.

The hostel life to begin with, especially of Amity Gwalior is amazing. The two separate hostels for boys and girls and canteens and mess that are shared by both make the place really hospitable. The campus area around the hostel is pretty homely and the rooms too are comfortable. The apartments style area for living with a shared lounge and bathroom makes it easy for students to live in. Gyms, TV area, laundry and Wi-Fi facility at all times give an edge to the hostels of Amity Gwalior. The hostels are spacious and provide a home away from home experience. There are separate buildings for boys and girls and canteens and mess where the entire hostel family dines together. Together rooms are on double occupancy basis worth a lounge and a washroom shared between 3 such rooms. Gym, TV area and the sports facilities are all there.

The best thing about Amity hostel is cleanliness & hygiene. Hostel management is much strict about solving the problem related to hostel services . Most important - Amity hostels don't include mess services. They have different cafeterias inside the campus but you'll get bored eating it daily. Although not economically feasibleYou need to get a day outpass or night outpass to go somewhere.Nigh outpass is only issued with a prior permission from your parents & Local guardian presence is must.You can get to know peopleFestival celebrations is also a good thing about amity hostels.Go for Non-AC hostel as AC hostel are expensive & aren't that feasible.Lastly , experience hostel life once . It's a different kind of experience with lots of learning.:)

The hostels in amity come with two variations one with AC and the Other Non-AC. The rooms are well maintained and are centrally air-conditioned, they provide bunk beds in their hostels and the mess facility is not included in the overall fees. If you are looking for a Hostel/PG accommodation there are several good options but if you don't want to miss out on anything during your stay. One such option is Stanza Living they provide the best accommodation services along with everything that a student requires be it Wifi, Laundry, Mess facilities, professional housekeeping services, regular events by Stanza Social and Stanza Springboard and a lot more.

From my personal experience, I can tell you that hostels of Amity University, Noida is not very good. The services are not good and management is not very helpful. There are a lot of restrictions on the students regarding the in-time. There are a lot of other options near Amity University, Noida. For ex on the opposite of gate no. 2 there is a Hostel provider company called Student inn which provides top quality hostel with a lot of facilities like spacious room, high-speed internet, in-room TV, gym, 4 times buffet a day, housekeeping services, 24*7 on-site security, etc.

Amity University Gwalior provides an excellent residential facilities for boys and girls. There are 3 Large Hostels in the campus Two for Boys and One for Girls. Currently the Hostels are serving as a home for around 750 Students. The hostel provides 24*7 high speed WiFi and unlimited internet access to the students. It also has indoor sports complex and gym (for both boys and girls). Not to forget about the common T.V room in both the hostels and a common mess where the whole hostel family dines together. To make the environment safe, healthy and more apt to study, the University ensures 24 hours water & power supply, tight security with surveillance cameras and 24/7 security guards and 24 hours medical care is also available. The Rooms are well ventilated and furnished.

I have stayed in H-5 and H-6. There are good. In H-6, for single room there is a flat and each flat have 4 rooms , a common area , a common washroom, a common toilet , a common fridge, a common sofa , common cloth stand. Each room has a cupboard, a bed, a table, a chair, sliding window of glass.. Rooms are quite good. You can survive there but only issues is lift because each hostel have 9 floor and even 2 floor person uses lift. That is why lift works slow…

The hostels at Amity are not bad but outside accommodation always has more pros. Especially if you’re staying at Stanza Living’s student residences. They’re convenient as well because they’re not far from the campus either. Yes, it won't be as close by but there are so many benefits of Stanza Living that made me choose it over the campus hostel. At Stanza Living they have many social and career-enhancement events. These are so much fun and we get to learn a lot from them as well! Of course, the basic necessities are covered too and I must say the quality of the services here are great.

The mantra of Amity hostel staff to create a home away from home.. All the hostels are Wi-Fi enabled and the student can access the net 24/7 from their rooms. The students are also provided free laundry services. To make the environment safe, healthy and more conducive to study, the University ensure 24 hours water & power supply, tight security with surveillance cameras and 24/7 security guards. 24 hours Medical Room is also available for any medical assistance.

Hostels are nice. Ac room are appartment styled with faculity of fidge and ac for free. You have to pay for food but that is affordable for a middle class student just 32/- per plate.. When we talk about non-ac rooms. They are not single and have double and tripple sharing. Again electricity is free. The facilities given justifies the fees they demand.

Amity Noida hostels are really good . They are spacious . They have a sofa in each flat that needs to be shared . They have Air Conditioners with an amazing power supply . There is a TV in each flat . Maids come regularly to clean and its really very neat and tidy place to live in . The flooring is great and amazing .

According to me they are pretty good. A little overpriced but good. It also depends upon your priorities and wants but if you ask me they have all the basic facilities required being bed table cupboard chair pilllow mattress. For ac rooms an extra sofa n fridge are included too.

The AC hostels are nice and comfortable. The room are small but the cubicle and washroom is nice as conpared to non ac. The cleanliness is A+. They have limited seats for AC and they get filled up very quickly . The Hostel block(h block) has many food joints and best place to hangout in amity.

Pretty nice actually. They are well maintained and with all facility. The rules are quite strict. There are two types : AC and Non Ac. In AC one’s you get your own room, you don’t have to share it. But, hostel accomodation is a little expensive in Amity Noida.

Well, If you are looking for hostel facility in Amity University than you can choose that but If you want hostel/PG facility outside your collage Placio is a Place which is fully furnished with the amenities like WI-Fi, laundry(At door step), hygienic food (veg and Non-Veg), study rooms and all with 27*7 support through IVR and Property Manager who is at your PG to solve your problem (in case you have any problem) apart from that there facilities are too safe and secure. For more information you can call@7053109531 or Click on link PG in Delhi University

Pretty good!! As I've been to boys hostels once. It was decent. My friend was living with two more roommates. AC and space was pretty much according to the students!! And the mess is also near where you can find variety of food!

response.answer_text: Hostels are good but expensive Non-ac is 1,50,000 Ac is 80,000 Without foods Anything u buy or eat there in the campus, u have to pay fr it irrespective of being an hosteler But hostel is fun!

Worse, Pathetic and words are less to describe. If I add something extra is that the cost of AC room for a year is equivalent to 2 year stay as Paying Guest Accommodation and specially an AC equipped.

AC hostels are good but too expensive.There is a convention of personal rooms to be allotted to every student in A.C. hostels but sometimes bunk bed are also allotted to some students in first year. In non a.c you will get rooms on sharing basis.
It depends on the kind of friends you make…but more or less students in Amity hostel are mostly non serious students.. but it largely depends on your circle..

A few things that you need to know about the restrictions in Amity hostel are: Curfew time of 9 PMCannot go out of hostel without taking prior permissionFood is not included in the hostel feeFood is available in the cafeteria and the menu is repetitive.
